    ë³µì‚¬ë¥¼ ìœ„í•´ íŒŒë€ìƒ‰ ìƒìë¥¼ í•œ ë²ˆ í´ë¦­í•˜ë©´ í•œ ë²ˆì— ì„ íƒë˜ë¯€ë¡œ ë°”ë¡œ ctrl+C, ctrl+V ì§„í–‰í•˜ë©´ ëœë‹¤.

    • Git ê¸°ë³¸ ì„¤ì •ì„ ë‹¤ì‹œ í™•ì¸í•œë‹¤.

    • https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/settings/ ì ‘ì†í•´ì„œ ì´ë©”ì¼ì´ ë§ê²Œ ì„¤ì •ë˜ì—ˆëŠ”ì§€ ì¬í™•ì¸í•œë‹¤.

    • ì—¬ê¸°ê¹Œì§€ì˜ ê¸°ë³¸ ì„¸íŒ…ì€ ë§¨ ì²˜ìŒ 1íšŒë§Œ ì§„í–‰í•˜ë©´ ëœë‹¤.

ë³¸ê²©ì ìœ¼ë¡œ ì½”ë“œë¥¼ ìˆ˜ì •í•´ë³´ì

ê¸°ë³¸ ì„¸íŒ…ê¹Œì§€ë„ ì™„ë£Œë˜ì—ˆìœ¼ë©´ ì•„ë˜ì˜ ì²´í¬ë¦¬ìŠ¤íŠ¸ë¥¼ ë”°ë¼ê°€ë©´ì„œ ì´ìŠˆë¥¼ í•´ê²°í•´ë³´ì.

  1. Create a new branch or witch to the correct branch

    • git checkout -b <branch_name> -t origin/main
    • ì‘ì—…ì„ ì‹œì‘í•˜ê¸° ì „ ëŠ˜ ìƒˆë¡œìš´ branchë¥¼ ìƒì„±í•´ ì§„í–‰í•œë‹¤.

    • +) ì‘ì—…í•˜ê³ ìí•˜ëŠ” crbug ìƒíƒœë¥¼ â€œstartedâ€ë¡œ ì „í™˜í•´ì„œ ì¤‘ë³µ ì‘ì—…ì„ í”¼í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆë„ë¡ í•˜ì.
    • http://dogfeet.github.io/articles/2012/git-tracking-vs-remote-tracking.html
    • https://git-scm.com/book/ko/v2/Git-ë¸Œëœì¹˜-ë¸Œëœì¹˜ë€-ë¬´ì—‡ì¸ê°€

    • upstreamì— ë³€ê²½ëœ ì‚¬í•­ì„ ê·¸ì™€ ì—°ê²°ëœ downstreamì— ì ìš©í•˜ë ¤ë©´ git rebase -i ëª…ë ¹ì–´ë¥¼ ì´ìš©í•´ rebase ì‘ì—…ì„ ì§„í–‰í•œë‹¤.

      ì‚¬ì‹¤ ì´ ë¶€ë¶„ì´ ì–´ë–¤ ê²½ìš°ë¥¼ ëœ»í•˜ëŠ”ì§€ ì˜ ëª¨ë¥´ê² ë‹¤;

  2. If thereâ€™s a local upstream branch, rebase the upstream changes

    • rebaseê°€ ëë‚˜ë©´ git rebase --continue ë¥¼ ì‹¤í–‰í•œë‹¤.
  3. Make your changes

  4. Make sure the code builds correctly

    • ë§ˆìŒê» ìˆ˜ì •í•œ ë’¤, ìµœì†Œí•œì˜ ê³µí†µ ëŒ€ìƒë“¤ì— ëŒ€í•´ ë¹Œë“œê°€ ì •ìƒì ìœ¼ë¡œ ì´ë£¨ì–´ì§€ëŠ”ì§€ í™•ì¸í•œë‹¤.

  5. Test your changes
  6. Write unit or browser tests for any new code

  7. Ensure the code is formatted nicely

    • git cl format --js ì„ ì‹¤í–‰í•´ ê¸°ë³¸ì ì¸ ì½”ë”© ê°€ì´ë“œë¥¼ ë§ì¶°ì¤€ë‹¤.

      • --js ì˜µì…˜ì€ JavaScriptë„ ê¸°ë³¸ formatì— ë§ê²Œ ìˆ˜ì •í•´ì¤€ë‹¤.

  8. Review your changes

    • git diff ë‚˜ git upstream-diff ë¥¼ ì´ìš©í•´ ì´ì „ ì»¤ë°‹ë“¤ê³¼ì˜ ë³€ê²½ì‚¬í•­ì„ ë‹¤ì‹œ í™•ì¸í•œë‹¤.
    • ì—¬ê¸°ì„œ git upstream-diffì˜ ê²°ê³¼ê°€ cl upload í–ˆì„ ë•Œ Gerritì— ì—…ë¡œë“œ ë˜ëŠ” ë‚´ìš©ì´ë‹¤.

  9. Stage relevant files for commit

    • git add ë¡œ ìˆ˜ì •í•œ ëª¨ë“  íŒŒì¼ë“¤ì„ ë“±ë¡í•œë‹¤.

  10. Commit your changes

    • commit message ì‘ì„±ë²•ì„ ì°¸ê³ í•´ì„œ ì»¤ë°‹ì„ ì§„í–‰í•œë‹¤.

  11. Squash your commits

    • ë„ˆë¬´ ë§ì€ ì»¤ë°‹ë“¤ì´ ìˆëŠ” ìƒí™©ì—ì„œ ì»¤ë°‹ë³„ ì¶©ëŒì„ ë°©ì§€í•˜ê¸° ìœ„í•´ì„œëŠ” í•˜ë‚˜ì˜ ì»¤ë°‹ìœ¼ë¡œ í•©ì³ì£¼ëŠ” ê²ƒì„ ê³ ë ¤í•´ë³¼ë§Œí•˜ë‹¤.
    • git commit --amend ëª…ë ¹ì–´ëŠ” ê°€ì¥ ìµœì‹  ì»¤ë°‹ì— í˜„ì¬ ìˆ˜ì •ë‚´ì—­ì„ í•©ì¹˜ëŠ” ë°©ì‹ì´ë‹¤.
    • git rebase -i ëª…ë ¹ì–´ë¥¼ ì´ìš©í•´ í¸ì§‘ê¸° í™”ë©´ì´ ëœ¨ë©´ pick ëŒ€ì‹  squashë¥¼ ì‘ì„±í•´ í•˜ë‚˜ì˜ ì»¤ë°‹ì— squashë¼ê³  ì“°ì¸ ì»¤ë°‹ë“¤ì´ í•©ì³ì§„ë‹¤.
    • https://git-scm.com/book/ko/v2/Git-ë„êµ¬-íˆìŠ¤í† ë¦¬-ë‹¨ì¥í•˜ê¸°
    • https://stackoverflow.com/questions/35044229/git-difference-between-amend-and-squash-commands

  12. Rebase your local repository

    • ë³€ê²½ì‚¬í•­ì„ ë™ê¸°í™”í•˜ê³  mergeì‹œ ë°œìƒí•˜ëŠ” ì¶©ëŒ ì˜¤ë¥˜ë¥¼ í•´ê²°í•˜ëŠ” ì ˆì°¨ì´ë‹¤.

    • git rebase-update ë¥¼ ì‹¤í–‰í•´ Chromium ì†ŒìŠ¤íŒŒì¼ë“¤(origin/main)ì„ ì—…ë°ì´íŠ¸í•˜ê³  rebaseí•œë‹¤.

      • ì´ ë•Œ ì¶©ëŒì´ ë°œìƒí•˜ë©´ ìˆ˜ë™ìœ¼ë¡œ ìˆ˜ì •ì´ í•„ìš”í•˜ë‹¤.

    • rebase ì´í›„ ë¹Œë“œê°€ ê¹¨ì§ˆ ìˆ˜ë„ ìˆìœ¼ë¯€ë¡œ gclient sync -D ë¥¼ í†µí•´ ì¢…ì†ì„±ì„ ì—…ë°ì´íŠ¸ì‹œì¼œì¤€ë‹¤

      • í•˜ìœ„ ì €ì¥ì†Œë“¤ë„ ë™ê¸°í™”í•˜ê³  ë”ì´ìƒ í•„ìš”í•˜ì§€ ì•ŠëŠ” ê²ƒì„ ì‚­ì œí•œë‹¤.
      • í•„ìš”ì— ë”°ë¼ hooksë¥¼ ë‹¤ì‹œ ì‹¤í–‰í•˜ê¸°ë„ í•œë‹¤.

  13. Upload the CL to Gerrit

    • git cl upload ë¥¼ ì‹¤í–‰ì‹œí‚¨ë‹¤.

      • -b <bug_number>ë¥¼ ì´ìš©í•˜ë©´ ìë™ì ìœ¼ë¡œ ì»¤ë°‹ë©”ì„¸ì§€ì— bug ì°¸ì¡°ê°€ ìƒê¸´ë‹¤. -b Noneë„ ì‚¬ìš©í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆë‹¤.

      • â€”edit-descriptionì„ ì´ìš©í•˜ë©´ ì»¤ë°‹ ë©”ì„¸ì§€ë¥¼ ì—…ë°ì´íŠ¸ í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆë‹¤.

        • ëŒ€ê´„í˜¸ë¥¼ ì‚¬ìš©í•´ì„œ hashtagë¥¼ ì¶”ê°€í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆë‹¤.
      • -rì˜µì…˜ì„ ì‚¬ìš©í•˜ë©´ ë¦¬ë·°ì–´ë¥¼ ì¶”ê°€í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆë‹¤.

    • git cl issueë¥¼ í†µí•´ ì˜¬ë°”ë¥¸ Gerritì˜ change listì— ì—…ë¡œë“œë˜ëŠ”ì§€ í™•ì¸í•œë‹¤.

      • ìƒˆë¡œìš´ change listë¼ë©´ issue numberëŠ” ë”°ë¡œ ì—†ê³  ì—…ë¡œë“œí•  ë•Œ ìë™ì ìœ¼ë¡œ ìƒì„±ëœë‹¤.
      • git cl issue <issue_number>ë¥¼ ì´ìš©í•˜ë©´ ìƒˆ íŒ¨ì¹˜ë¥¼ ì—…ë¡œë“œí•˜ê¸° ìœ„í•´ ê¸°ì¡´ change listë¥¼ ì§€ì •í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆë‹¤.
    • Patch titleì„ ì˜ ì‘ì„±í•´ì£¼ì.

  14. Check the CL again in Gerrit

    • git cl webì„ í†µí•´ ì—°ê²°ëœ Gerrit URLë¡œ ì ‘ì†í•˜ê³  ì—…ë¡œë“œëœ íŒŒì¼ë“¤ì´ ì˜¬ë°”ë¥¸ì§€ í™•ì¸í•˜ì.
    • ë¦¬ë·° ìš”ì²­ ì „ì— ìì²´ì ìœ¼ë¡œ ê²€í† í•˜ì.

  15. Make sure all auto-regression tests pass

  16. Add reviewers to review your code

item.title: Quick Start
item.description: Getting Started ğŸ˜ 1. Create a Gatsby site. If you are not using , following Gatsby Getting Started 2. Start developing. 3. Add your contentâ€¦
item.content:encoded:
Getting Started ğŸ˜

1. Create a Gatsby site.

# create a new Gatsby site using the blog starter
$ npx gatsby new my-blog-starter https://github.com/JaeYeopHan/gatsby-starter-bee

If you are not using npx, following Gatsby Getting Started

$ npm install -g gatsby-cli
$ gatsby new my-blog-starter https://github.com/JaeYeopHan/gatsby-starter-bee

2. Start developing.

$ cd my-blog-starter/
$ npm start
# open localhost:8000

3. Add your content

You can writeâ€¦

  • contents to blog in content/blog directory.
  • resume content/__about directory.

With markdown syntax and some meta data

Support script for creating new post

$ npm run post

4. Fix meta data

You can fix meta data of blog in /gatsby-meta-config.js file.

5. Publish with netlify

ğŸ’¡ if you want to deploy github pages, add following script to package.json

"scripts": {
    "deploy": "gatsby build && gh-pages -d public -b master -r 'git@github.com:${your github id}/${github page name}.github.io.git'"
}

:memo: Write a post!

content
â”œâ”€â”€ __about
â””â”€â”€ blog
  • You can register your resume on the web. (in __about directory)
  • You can register your post. (in blog directory)

ğŸ§ Customize!

Gatsby config

/root
â”œâ”€â”€ gatsby-browser.js // font, polyfill, onClientRender ...
â”œâ”€â”€ gatsby-config.js // Gatsby config
â”œâ”€â”€ gatsby-meta-config.js // Template meta config
â””â”€â”€ gatsby-node.js // Gatsby Node config

Structure

src
â”œâ”€â”€ components // Just component with styling
â”œâ”€â”€ layout // home, post layout
â”œâ”€â”€ pages // routing except post: /(home), /about
â”œâ”€â”€ styles
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ code.scss
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ dark-theme.scss
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ light-theme.scss
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ variables.scss
â””â”€â”€ templates
    â”œâ”€â”€ blog-post.js
    â””â”€â”€ home.js

Style

You can customize color in src/styles directory.

src/styles
â”œâ”€â”€ code.scss
â”œâ”€â”€ dark-theme.scss
â”œâ”€â”€ light-theme.scss
â””â”€â”€ variables.scss

Welcome to gatsby-starter-bee! Happy blogging! ğŸ‘»

item.title: Welcome Bee starter
item.description: Welcome, Gatsby! This starter is full-package for your new blog! 1. Support Four frontmatter title date category draft 2. Code highlightingâ€¦
item.content:encoded:
Welcome, Gatsby! This starter is full-package for your new blog!

1. Support Four frontmatter

---
title: 'Welcome Bee starter'
date: 2019-2-6 16:21:13
category: 'development'
draft: false
---
  1. title
  2. date
  3. category
  4. draft

2. Code highlighting

  1. With Fira Code font
  2. Support highlighting with prism 2-1. Use inline highlighting
import React from 'react'

const TEMPLATE = 'gatsby-starter-bee'
class Foo extends React.Component {
  handleClick = val => {
    if (val === 'bar') {
      return 1
    } else if (val !== 'zoo') {
      return 2
    }
    console.log(`clicked`)
    return 3
  }

  render() {
    return <div>Welcome, Gatsby, ${TEMPLATE}</div>
  }
}

code

3. Support Markdown (h2)

  1. With Noto Sans font
  2. Support header anchoring

h3

h4

h5

quote!

bold italic

4. Support emoji ğŸš€

Based on emojione ğŸ™

5. Support light/dark mode

6. Support social sharing feature

  1. Twitter
  2. Facebook

Bonus, Buy me a coffee button

Set, buyMeACoffeeId of gatsby-meta-config.js

7. Comments feature

You can add comments feature by selecting one of them.

  • Disqus
  • utterances

8. Support latex

Support latex rendering with katex plugin.

$$\prod_{i=a}^{b} f(i)$$

âˆi=abf(i)\prod_{i=a}^{b} f(i)âˆi=abâ€‹f(i)

9. Other features of this template

  1. You can add resume to /about
  2. Lazy rendering
  3. Scroll restoration
  4. Categorize posts
  5. Offline caching with service worker (based gatsby)
  6. Support GA(Google Analytics)

Letâ€™s Start! Go

item.title: about
item.description: Your name Thank you for reading my resume. If you want to contact me, Please send me an email.
item.content:encoded:
Your name

Thank you for reading my resume. If you want to contact me, Please send me an email.
